website_summaries.verdict: An extra large canopy constructed of UPF 50 fabric keeps delicate skin well protected from harmful UV rays.
pros: Removable padding, wrap-around arms, and a five point harness deliver superb comfort and security
Suitable for babies from 10 months old
Features a cup holder and storage basket for essentials
Pedal locking system keeps little feet safe
cons: Steering with the parent handle could be easier
Cup holder comes off a little too easily

customer_reviews.title: Best gift ever for 10 month old child
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for his first Christmas gift. We walk a lot in our neighborhood. The quality on this is fantastic. My 10 mo was all smiles during the test ride. We live in a cold climate so we’re waiting for spring to really try it out in the street.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Chauvin

customer_reviews.title: Not for outside use
customer_reviews.text: assembly would have been very easy if many of the parts would have been precut properly. Poor design and material, my child is 2 and we walk 2 miles outside daily. The wheels are small and built for natural terrain, the steering column is terrible and you must wiggle back and forth to keep it in a straight line. The seating area is safe a comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy handle for such an expensive item.
customer_reviews.text: Handle is Built kinda flimsy for how $$$$$ it costs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but good to know for others
customer_reviews.text: We had to secure the tray over the back wheels (drilled 2 holes & ran zip tie) because my grandson was playing with the bike & pushed on the tray & it came unattached from around the bike frame & his weight fell forward & he cut his cheek on the sharp plastic part that snaps around the frame. Quickly resolved, but good to know for others. Also ... would be great to have a step on brake on the back wheels the adult can control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great
customer_reviews.text: Love the pink color love the big sun canopy love the storage compartment at the bottom for parents stuff or baby's stuff, but why I couldn't give it 5 stars is its a lot more flimsy and cheaply made then I thought it was going to be seeing as it's joovy brand. My 18month toddler girl is only 25pounds and when pushing to turn her left or right all her weight nearly tips her over in this which is weird I don't think it should be $100 but besides that I do like it and most importantly my little girl LOVES IT.
customer_reviews.author: shayne lewis

customer_reviews.title: The concept of 4-1 was nice, but when I was putting the wheels on
customer_reviews.text: The concept of 4-1 was nice, but when I was putting the wheels on, two failed to snap in place and hold. If it had not been two days before the birthday party, I would have returned it. So sad. We managed to super glue and tape the tires so they would hold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvement, but best at this price point
customer_reviews.text: This review is based on me purchasing (and returning) a similar item. Assembly was extremely easy and overall it seems sturdy. There are a few things that could be designed better, but having purchased and returned others this is the one of the better ones on the market at this price point at this time. The push handle needs to be improved and could be a little more sturdy and have a different handle so you could steer only with hand ; the cup holder comes off a bit too easily. I’ve now actually had to request 2 replacement parental handles. Disappointed as I’ve only had for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: SeeKateShop

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice at first, then rolls downhill
customer_reviews.text: This tricycle looked really nice at first look, but after having it for a couple days, we realised it was cheaply made. The wheels began to squeek and fall apart almost immediately. The handle for pushing has become really wobbly after some use and the cup holder and other things pop off at will. I wish I had picked a better model. My daughter loves the thing, but it's a pain for us to use.
customer_reviews.author: Werewolf-girl

customer_reviews.title: Looks good at first but is not very high quality
customer_reviews.text: The bike looks really good, but it is not made sturdy. 1. The canopy is made of this cheap material that hangs and the whole construction is flimsy, so we are not able to use it very well. 2. The water bottle holder and the other storage thing at the bottom keep falling off. 3. The wheels are nice and made out of rubber, so I like that Overall, the bike is not a $100 bike. I bought a different one for my daughter and that one is way better made. I would honestly send this one back but it's gonna take too long to disassemble and repackage it.
customer_reviews.author: Galina

customer_reviews.title: Great Tricyle
customer_reviews.text: This trike was much easier and sturdier than the last one I got for my daughter. Instructions to put it together could have been done better but overall putting it all together was pretty simple process. Only problem I had with this was it squeaked after our first trip around the block, so I put some WD40 on the wheel area and that fixed it. One other feature they can incorporate into this is a braking system like the last one I had. Overall I am still happy with this because of the smoothness of the ride and how it feels like it was actually an engineered product.
customer_reviews.author: 997c2s

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for our 2 year old boy. The quality isn’t very good and raises safety concerns. The safety harness broke within just a few days. To make it worse, I’ve emailed and called Joovy three times with no response or help in getting the seatbelt/harness replaced. This is pretty much an all plastic tricycle, buyer be warned.
customer_reviews.author: B. Luce

customer_reviews.title: Safe and secure for little ones.
customer_reviews.text: We gave it to our 8 month old granddaughter for Christmas and she and her parents are delighted with it. The baby guard is an outstanding feature, as well as the canopy. There are short pedals for her to put her feet on as she grows and then the regular pedals that will help her learn to make it go herself. Also the handle bars will prepare her for when she's on her own. It's easy steering for the adult, and the adjustable adult handle is ideal for short and tall parents, which she has.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M.

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and safe
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month old LOVES this tryc. He can’t peddle yet so we left the parent handle on. I don’t have a helmet for him yet so we also left the guard on around his waist. It’s very sturdy and safe. He prefers it over his stroller and I can’t wait until he can drive it himself. Highly recommend! It’s pricey but so worth it for durability and ease of assembly. It just clicks together.
customer_reviews.author: N. Shea

customer_reviews.title: It will work
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to put together. Looks nice. The canopy is super flimsy. I don’t see it lasting long. The cup holder and the little tray on the back of the wheels just kind of sits there. It is not secure and falls off easily. The rear holder will not hold a pile of rocks if that’s what your kiddo decides to use it for. I see it coming off and staying off within the year. Overall I’m happy with it as it was the cheapest one I found, but it definitely does not feel built to last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Um, the wheels fall off...
customer_reviews.text: The left wheel on this trike fell off several times while in use. The mechanism for holding it to the shaft is just too flimsy. Mom said no more and was ready to return it, but Dad was able drill a hole through the shaft and secure the wheel to the axle with a bolt, and it's been good since. I'd prefer pneumatic tires for a smoother ride instead of the sold plastic ones with the thin rubber cover, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Servant

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you want you kid to cry
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my 1 year old to push him around on. There’s a place for them to put their feet which is fine if toddlers actually held their feet still. So they end up hitting the pedals which is also not a big deal if your going completely straight but the minute you turn their feet get crushed against the pedals and the frame. Not a very good design. The pegs should also be removable and this would help a little.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall not bad
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. the seat is larger than on some other trikes, like radio flyer 2. I appreciate padding 3. Overall not bad, not hard to maneuver 4. Handle height is adjustable Cons: 1. Flimsy and squeaky. For the price i would expect more 2. Would be nice to have a larger basket Overall not bad, but my toddler wouldn’t sit in it even once.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall I think it’s a great bike!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tricycoo 4.1 for my 11 month old. It was pretty easy to assemble, the color is a bright nice blue, the seat has padding for comfort, it has a big cup holder but beware if your baby likes to touch they will probably knock it off lol. It has a basket to store a few toys which is nice, I didn’t like that the parent control handle is a bit flimsy I would have prefer something more sturdy but not a big deal it’s better then a lot of other trikes for kids and my kid loves it he enjoys riding in it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Melendez

customer_reviews.title: Great started
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson when he was just about a year old. We’ve used it for two years now and it was great for the “stages”;of his growth. He is just now learning to pedal the trike so we still have the handle on the back to assist. The wheels are plastic so I don’t think it will be his trike after this year. Looking for more rubber wheels and durability
customer_reviews.author: Janet D

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!
customer_reviews.text: The first ride on this thing for my child and her foot got caught twice between the wheel and the axle support above the pedals just like previous reviewers have said happened to them. First time I thought it was just a fluke or that she let her foot wander in some random spot. Not ten minutes later it happened again and it peeled some skin off my child's ankle. Tears for an hour. This thing is dangerous and poorly designed. It's also very crummy construction and material for such a high price. I will be buying the radio flyer our friends lent us, much higher quality and lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Baby Brooklyn loves her stroller/tryke.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a close friends baby. She was so excited the first time they put her in it and Mom took her for a stroll around the little park. She could reach the pedals but now she can, and is learning how to make it work. It was a gift that has given Mom her workouts walking daily, and baby Brooklyn her stroller/trike... both are happy. Dad also said it was easy to assemble also.
customer_reviews.author: eqpr

customer_reviews.title: This is a horrible product.
customer_reviews.text: This is so bad, I think AMZN should pull it off the "shelf" or recall it. The tricycle is poorly designed, made of super cheap material. It looked like it's about to fall apart since day one, it squeaks, parts are loose, just a VERY horrible product. For the six months we've had it, I had to repair several times from the belt harness, to the push rod in the back. Do yourself a favor and do NOT purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Maia Bojinova

customer_reviews.title: ... old received this for her first birthday and we love it! Nice change from the stroller for our ...
customer_reviews.text: My one year old received this for her first birthday and we love it! Nice change from the stroller for our evening walks. Seems like the cushion provides more comfort than other brands. Its comfortable enough that she has fallen asleep riding in it 😁 The only downside is we do not have sidewalks in our neighborhood so seems like the tires may not last as long from using it on the street.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: for the price-just ok
customer_reviews.text: not totally thrilled with this purchase it works ok but it doesn't turn very well (really wide turns) I wish they would have used zipper instead of velcro to attach the padding because my son just rips it off.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L.

customer_reviews.title: Riding in style
customer_reviews.text: Super cute! Could not wait to take this for a spin with my daughter. She loved it, and got plenty of compliments from passerby’s. If I could give a suggestion I would say, to give an option for the back of the chair to layback. My daughter fell asleep and was uncomfortably sloughing. We end up having to take her out and carry her for the rest of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Dockins Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Fun tricycle but needs better alignment.
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoy this tricycle. It was easy to assemble and our Little One loves it! My only compliant is the alignment is off so in order for the front wheel to be straight the parent handle bar is off centered. Makes for difficult walks.
customer_reviews.author: S T

customer_reviews.title: A flimsy, plasticy, almost useless peice of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter, she is too small to reach the pedals so I have been using it in stroller mode. The handle used to push it is extremely wobbly, as others have noted. I spent some time (on promptly answered call to Joovy) with a rep, she seemed understanding and sent me a new handle. it is not the handle per se that is the problem, it is not attached to the trike in a robust manner. Might be Ok as a pedal trike but even then the wheels do not turn easily and if you are anything other than smooth pavement, it is a nightmare
customer_reviews.author: Stuart  Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and flimsy feeling
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap feeling. The handle that is your only control over it is very flimsy, bending whenever you try to turn it. The wheels aren't really made for asphalt, it feels like. It's also very difficult to turn. I'm not sure how others compare, but at this price point, this doesn't feel worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Good Transitional Bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my 3year old. I would have gave this bike a 4 stars. The intial look and sturdness of the bike was great. Once my 3 yeah old and i took it for a driven outside I noticed the pushing handle became a bit wobbly. I hope it doesn't break. However I think the purpose of the bike will do just fine. Hopefully she will know how to ride a it before she is 4.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure ones she will grow up she will enjoy it!
customer_reviews.text: My baby is a little small for it, she is just 2 years old and also a pettite size. But she already loves it. I'm sure ones she will grow up she will enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Hanganu Ana

customer_reviews.title: ... for our 10 month old and it has been awesome! He hated the stroller but actually asks to ...
customer_reviews.text: We got rid of our stroller for this Tricycoo for our 10 month old and it has been awesome! He hated the stroller but actually asks to ride in his Trike. I took a star away because I wish the handlebars had a cupholder for me and somewhere to clip a bag. But still a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: The Atlheas

customer_reviews.title: Rickety and Doesn't Do the Job
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk! So rickety and hard to assemble. My 15-month-old daughter is in the 5th percentile for height and the sun shade barely clears her head. She's constantly moving it out of her face/head space, which makes it worthless to use. The petals do not lock so they turn and smush her feet against the foot rests (which aren't angled and she can't keep her feet on). It also tips over rather easily so it's just dangerous! There is no snack tray which is a bummer, and the cup holder can be pulled off easily so my daughter fiddles throws it on the ground constantly. Don't waste your money on this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Use it more than our stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Use it more than our stroller. Like the versatility of using it at 9 months, and then being able to use it as a trike. Got our money's worth after the first month. Portable enough. Seems durable. Front basket does not stay on well. Handle doesn't quite match direction of wheels. Wish there was a way to disengage child steering so they could pretend to turn without fighting against me steering.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H. Kiedrowski

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like this SO badly!
customer_reviews.text: After LOADS of research, we decided on this trike for our growing toddler. It didn't have the best of everything, but seemed like the best overall choice. I thought I'd love it, but it was just so flimsy. By our second trip around the community, one side of the sunshade kept popping off (and nothing could get it to stay) and it made a godawful squealing noise. Back to the drawing board for a modifiable trike that I don't have to bend over to help her steer.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Watson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I think the handle bar is a bit flimsy... it’s just wiggly. For how much I paid, I expected the handle bar to be sturdy and strong.... not the case. I was walking with my 1yr old and he almost tilted over and if he would have, I’m sure the handle would have broken... it wouldn’t helped at all. It is cute though. I wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for a 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my twin girls when they were about 8 months old. It has been a life saver when we go shopping. They will be able to grow with my kids as well. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Hhammes

customer_reviews.title: My son loves the joovy!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my 8 month old son and he loves it! We go on trips to the local supermarket with this and it’s so easy to use and best of all, keeps baby entertained. Assembly was very easy. Took about 10 minutes. Would recommend this for all parents!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Top choice
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one each for two grandchildren, age 16 and 18 months. Perfect choice. Easy to assemble and they both love them. Long walks just made easier. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 18 month old daughter and she loves it! This product is definitely worth it! I would highly recommend any parents who want their child to have fun, while not hurting your back by pushing them.
customer_reviews.author: Ngoc Vo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome features like the ability to allow the pedals to ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome features like the ability to allow the pedals to spin freely and the canopy provides great sun coverage. I wish it folded up for transport but otherwise thrilled with it! The seat padding cover comes off very easily for washing too, which was something I wondered about when purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Ann

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: The product does not work, it turns so hard that my little one is unable to steer it. I have sent multiple emails contacting Joovy because the item is defective. They are of no help and say it works fine. They will return but say I have to pay shipping. This is a terrible company. I would have to pay more to ship the piece of junk back than it is worth.
customer_reviews.author: CGant

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: My niece loves it! It's super cute. It's a little too loose on the maneuvering part, if that makes sense. Worth it, nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Noel. J

customer_reviews.title: It’s Aight
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this thing. The handle is crooked and bends when you steer. It doesn’t seem very sturdy and is mostly plastic. Was a bit disappointed in that, but it is okay for what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: M Sel

customer_reviews.title: great little scooter for the 10 mo old
customer_reviews.text: we have only been using it indoors for now to go around the house. Well made and he's entertained for a couple of minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: My son broke the tricycle after using it twice. The straps doesn't hold well and the wheels aren't sturdy enough for a toddler. Love the color.
customer_reviews.author: riz

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this , I’ve had it for nearly two years now and I’m just now turning it into a trike! I love the features and I will be keeping it for the next kiddo to!
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: Wheels fell apart after two trips
customer_reviews.text: Took our 21-month old toddler out twice on this and the wheels were splitting and basically fling apart. Rode only on sidewalks or roads. No way would this last through three or four different configurations with replacing the wheels several.times. returned in less than a week.
customer_reviews.author: NC Negin

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to take little ones.
customer_reviews.text: My husband thought this was a waste of money when I ordered it, but my one and two year old grandkids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hocking

customer_reviews.title: READ.
customer_reviews.text: My sons foot got pulled between the wheel, and the front forks. The foot rest is a nice idea but baby explores using all appendages. Definitely a safety issue. Beware. Called joovy for advice. They had nothing to say. Into the trash it goes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: The perfect gift.
customer_reviews.text: I like this item it was easy to put together my granddaughter loves it she's 21 months old and yes I would buy it again I read all the reviews and still went with this bike after looking at lot of sites i give it a 100. Must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Ceasar

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old grandson loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandson's 1st birthday. He loved sitting up and being in charge. Looking forward to many more years of use and fun!
customer_reviews.author: C. BELL

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I get so many compliments on this bike. I put my son in it when he was around 6 months (he’s a big baby) and it’s been great. Only complaint is the top canopy can be a little temperamental but the bike itself is by far the best one I’ve seen
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Nice....But
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said the peddles don’t Fully lock all the way and they will spin I’m worried about him getting his feet caught .also it does have a weak handle and the canopy is flimsy .. other than it is nice but still wouldn’t recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Super cute!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and durable! We will get a ton of use out of it. The instructions were a bit difficult to read, so that’s why I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lambs and Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Not that much close its described.
customer_reviews.text: This is not much easy to push the handle is little unstrong to push but the bycicle is good for little one it says starts from 1 years till 5 buty baby is 2 years old her leg not reach the gear i think its good to use start from age 3. Bit expensive it should cost 70-80$.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I love that he enjoys it so much
customer_reviews.text: We can't get our little guy out of this Tricycoo! I love that he enjoys it so much. Every time he see's it-- he begs to go for a ride. I pack it up in my trunk and take it to places so it makes shopping or walking more enjoyable for the rest of the family.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Moede

customer_reviews.title: My 16 month old granddaughter loves this... ...
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month old granddaughter loves this....she asks to go on a ride several times a day.....we go twice!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Great bike but had some flaws
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bike! It was easy to assemble & is really sturdy however the cup holder is in a bad spot because it’s perfect reach for my baby to rip it right off! And like others have said the tray on the bottom doesn’t stay on. I gave it 4 stars for those flaws
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. My son hated strollers, but he loves this one.
customer_reviews.author: SeaSide

customer_reviews.title: Smile in my kids always fills my heart
customer_reviews.text: We love it my baby is really happy and she enjoys it it was easy to assemble it
customer_reviews.author: Zumrut Parlapanova

customer_reviews.title: So perfect for our walks
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter ( 21 months old) loves it. So perfect for our walks !
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Clifton

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike
customer_reviews.text: I love it, my granddaughter does not want to get off of it. The only thing I wish is the canopy is only usable with the seatbelt and and back rest. So when they are older and do not need so much support and safety measures you cannot attach the shade piece. Other than that we LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad tricycle
customer_reviews.text: Dispite the poor instructions, it’s not hard to put together. Unfortunately you can’t have a seatbelt/shoulder straps unless you also have the lap bar attached. The adult push handle is a bit wabbly.
customer_reviews.author: Marin Damerow

customer_reviews.title: It will do till he gets a real bike
customer_reviews.text: Would get perfect stars if it was a built just a little better. It works just fine but just feels cheap. Also the spot where the canopy awning visor or whatever you wanna call it broke first day
customer_reviews.author: jakob

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Hated this bike. I purchased it as a gift for my daughter in January but did t open it until May when the weather became Nice. Product fell apart after a few weeks and my daughter almost fell out of it. Never purchasing again!
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Really like this stroller tricycle
customer_reviews.text: I’d rate this a 5 but my grandson is tall for 19 months and his feet drag because he doesn’t get how to use the pedals
customer_reviews.author: Lisagarri

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tricycle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old Great Niece for Christmas. Needless to say she LOVES it! It’s very well made and of course it’s super-cute in pink!!! She is loving it more than I even imagined she would!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Tricycoo for the win!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son’s first birthday and we love it! It’s sturdy, comfortable, and well worth the price. I did a lot of research before purchasing and I couldn’t be more pleased. I’m excited to see him grow with this bike for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: MaryElizabeth Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The steering handle broke at the base about a month it. The company was great and replaced it free of charge. But the second bike has already broken in the same spot. We use it on our grass and our driveway, nothing crazy! I wish that steering bar was more sturdy- it’s just plastic. My daughter loved it so it’s really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bielat

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Great cool looking bike. However material is looking to cheap and feels cheap. Very difficult to Maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: David O'Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Beware of footwear
customer_reviews.text: Gift for one year old grandchild. Footrests were out. Foot slipped off and wedged in between front wheel and the bent piece next to it as shown with my shoe in photo. Joovy rep told me I should have trained the rider, 12 months old and w/in product age range, to keep feet on stationery pegs. Seriously? Why no strap in case a 12 month old has learning issues?
customer_reviews.author: Lizbeth

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with product!!
customer_reviews.text: I bough this last month and it is already falling apart. I have bot done much with it and it stays in the back hatch of my suv most of the time. Im extremely disappointed with the quality of this product when i paid over $100 for it. Will not purchase a JOOVY product again!
customer_reviews.author: Maygen S.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Gave it as a gift today for a one-year-old and she is in love
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All in all great product!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my one year old. She loved it and it was great to go on walks and take to the park. I love that you have so many options with this. She is now 3 and is still using it just as a tricycle now. Its extremely durable, easy to use, and love its unique look. All in all a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany and Stefanie Narey

customer_reviews.title: Great niece
customer_reviews.text: My great niece loved it.. I’m the favorite great auntie
customer_reviews.author: Dalia Black

customer_reviews.title: Very stable when child is loaded properly
customer_reviews.text: Very unique product, well built. Stroller/Trike represents a good value and should work for several years. Great fade resistant colors. Durable and easy to use straps.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Huber

customer_reviews.title: For younger child perfect
customer_reviews.text: Like it a lot .. but be carful if ur child is trying to climb out or is on the heavy side the trycoo will tip over happend to my child Soo many times

customer_reviews.title: Great ride and easy to push
customer_reviews.text: This is such a better quality to the older trikes. Better wheels, ride and overall quality. Love it and so does my toddler.

customer_reviews.title: ENJOY!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it and so does my 14month old! Easy to push, assemble and so much fun!! Favorite part is I live in Fl and it shades enough sun!!!

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this trike
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this trike! Easy to put together and most of all, granddaughter loves it - uses it as a stiller. She's a tall 9 month old and fits securely in it. Second Joovy product I've purchased (bought the 'walker'), and highly recommend this brand!

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My one year old nephew loves it! Very comfortable compared to radio flyer and nice sun protection from hood.

customer_reviews.title: Impossible

customer_reviews.author: Tammi Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great first trike for my grandson
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this tricycle for my 10 month old grandson who did not like being buckled into his stroller. The Joovy Tricycoo is perfect for him. He loves being pushed around in it and is so much happier taking walks. It is a sturdy tricycle that will be great as he grows and can begin to push or pedal himself.
customer_reviews.author: William P

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed because the cup holder and cover is falling all the time. The second defect -spot where the parent handle connects to the trike became very loose and made the trike more difficult to steer. But still easier than another brand. I like wheels of this bike and riding without noise. This bike is used by two children. My daughter is 2,5 years old and so 18 months. Babies love this! Trike is very useful for both of them because it features a flip-down footrest for the child to rest their feet on-and that works! Very easy to fold and put to the car trunk. I hope my review helped you.
customer_reviews.author: Lukasz

customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and my 4 month old granddaughter has been able to sit in it already due to the secure straps that hold her in place but unless your baby has great head control I do not recommend using this at such an early age.

customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves it. We had a little trouble with a mismatching part which was immediately resolved by the manufacturer.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this item!

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: It feels kind of cheap and I purchased it with that in mind bc other buyers said the same thing. I definitely don’t think it’s going to last thru the toddler year. The wheels are plastic so not durable for long walks.

customer_reviews.title: Came used and in a car seat box
customer_reviews.text: This was sent to me in an obviously used condition. The wheels are dirty and the box it arrived in was an car seat box turned inside out. I did not pay over $100 for a used item. Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Robia Davenport

customer_reviews.title: It was easy and fast very cute and she loves it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this bike. I am not handy at all and I built it myself with just a small struggle with one screw. It was easy and fast very cute and she loves it. The cover on top is a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Liana Wenzel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice trike so far
customer_reviews.text: Very nice trike so far. Simple to put together. Only bad thing is my son gets his feet in between wheel and the forks. But still a nice unit. Just have to get him use to using the foot rest instead of the finder.

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS! NOT SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is easy. It is not that solid. The handle for turning has quite a bit of wiggle. DANGEROUS FOR CHILDREN! THE WHEEL IS TOO EXPOSED, MY SON'S FOOT WAS CAUGHT WHILE WE WERE PUSHING HIM! DO NOT BUY!

customer_reviews.title: almost as expected
customer_reviews.text: I do like this bike very much as does my granddaughter. The only thing is that I thought it would be easier to move the seat. I didn't realize I would need an Allen wrench each time to adjust it.
customer_reviews.author: Diana B.

product_meta.title: Joovy Tricycoo 4.1 Kid's Tricycle, Push Tricycle, Toddler Trike, Blue
product_meta.description: Color:BlueThe Joovy Tricycoo 4.1 is your child's first vehicle and the perfect way to introduce balance and coordination, one step at a time. Ideal for babies as young as 10 months, the Tricycoo 4.1 transforms through 4 stages as your child grows. Stage 1 (10 months+) - Parents have full control with the adjustable and removable parent push handle. Baby sits in a padded seat with head support, surround arms and a 5-point harness for their comfort and safety. The extra-large canopy has multiple positions and is made of a 50 UPF fabric to keep baby cool and harmful sun rays away. Stage 2 (18 months+) - This stage is gearing up for the training stage. The Tricycoo 4.1 features a flip-down footrest for the child to rest their feet on. You can set the pedals to freewheel which prevents the pedals from spinning and avoids hitting little legs and feet. The extra comfy shoulder and seat pads are removable and machine washable. Stage 3 (24 months+) - Parents can remove the surround arms and lock the pedals to allow the child to pedal by themselves. Large pedals make it easier for the child to place their feet on and learn to pedal. The Tricycoo 4.1 features a large 10" front wheel (larger than the competition) and 7.5" rear wheels for easier riding. Stage 4 (30 months+) - A 3-position adjustable seat accommodates growing legs. The parent handle is removed completely for kid powered fun. A convenient cup holder and rear storage basket are perfect for child must-haves.
feature_bullets: 4-stage trike adjusts as child grows, for babies from 10 months and up to 44 pounds
Front Wheel Pedal Locking System, fold down footrest and removable baby surround arms assist a younger child
Parent push handle is removable and height adjustable from 32.5 to 38 inches. Stand over height 14 inches
3-position adjustable seat accommodates a growing child, shoulder and seat pads are removable and washable
Large UVF 50 canopy provides sun protection, includes cup holder and rear storage basket

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars669 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
